title: Tile Panel, 1960-1-74, Early 18th century
medium: Light buff earthenware, polychrome underglaze painting
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description:
Six square and three rectangular tiles, set in cament. St. Ignatius of Loyola kneeling on globe, set aflame by lightning emanating from his raised right hand; in sky, halo-encircled IHS; attended by four female figures, allegories of the Four Continents, and thier animals; cockatoo, alligator, horse and camel. Inscription: "Et quid volo nisi ut accendayur/ accendetur velut ignis zelus tuu. ps 70."

Painting related to an engraving by Petrus Costa (died 1761)
